summary: The Spotted Lanternfly Research and Development Act (H.R. 4708) aims to amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990. The bill focuses on combating the spotted lanternfly, an invasive insect. It proposes including research and development grants for controlling the lanternfly under high-priority research and extension initiatives. Furthermore, it seeks to reauthorize existing high-priority research initiatives within the act, extending their funding to 2030.
